did.unittitle: Robert Fitch Papers

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Robert "Bob" Fitch was born in Chicago in December 1938. He received a PhD in sociology from the State University of New York (SUNY), Binghampton. A Marxist and prolific writer on many topics, Fitch was particularly concerned with unionism. As well as writing about them, he worked as union organizer for the American Federation of Musicians, Local 802 in New York City during the mid 1980s. Fitch also taught and lectured at universities throughout New York City. He died aged 72 in March 2011.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Robert Fitch Papers primarily contain Fitch's research materials on different labor unions, particularly in the New York City area. Boxes 25-26, donated after his death in 2011, include personal materials and memorabilia.
